summary: This document is an email chain from April 1, 2019, between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI, discussing the logistics of scanning and transferring a large volume of records (16,000 to 29,000 pages) related to the Epstein investigation. It highlights inter-agency coordination efforts.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email on January 30, 2019, providing contact information and coordinating with the FBI on the transfer of Epstein investigation records.

connections.person1: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is coordinating with FBI personnel regarding the scanning, transmission, and cataloging of investigative records in the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial coordination call on records
events.description: A conversation between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding Epstein investigation records, followed by an email providing contact information.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Follow-up on record transmission
events.description: A check-in to confirm whether 16,000 or all 29,000 pages of scanned records were transmitted to a colleague ('S'), and to request an index of the materials.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Follow-up on upload to shared drive
events.description: An email following up on a previous conversation to check if all materials had been uploaded to the 'W drive'.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing coordination in early 2019 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI regarding the Epstein investigation.
It references a large volume of investigative records, specifically 16,000 to 29,000 pages that needed to be scanned, transmitted, and cataloged.
The emails show a focus on logistical details, such as uploading files to a shared drive ('W drive') and creating an index of the materials.
The correspondence indicates the involvement of multiple team members from both the prosecutor's office and the FBI, though most specific names are redacted.
